greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by columns: Column k is A014963 aerated with groups of (k-1) zeros.
comment: If the row number n is prime, the row consists of T(n,1)=n followed by n-2 zeros and followed by T(n,n)=1.
Row products of nonzero terms in row n, equals n. - _Mats Granvik_, May 22 2016
link: T. Tao, Simons Lecture I: Structure and randomness in Fourier analysis and number theory.
formula: Limit as s -> 1 of the recurrence: Ts(n, k) = if k = 1 then zeta(s)*(1 - 1/n^(s - 1)) -Sum_{i=2..n} Ts(n, i)/(i)^(s - 1) else if n mod k = 0 then Ts(n/k, 1) else 0 else 0.
For n not equal to k: Limit as s -> 1 of the recurrence: Ts(n, k) = if k = 1 then zeta(s) -Sum_{i=2..n} Ts(n, i)/i^(s - 1) else if n mod k = 0 then Ts(n/k, 1) else 0 else 0.
Limit as s -> 1 of the recurrence: Ts(n, k) = if k = 1 then log(n) -Sum_{i=2..n} Ts(n, i)/i^(s - 1) else if n mod k = 0 then Ts(n/k, 1) else 0 else 0. (End)
[The above sentences need a lot of work!  Parentheses might help. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 14 2017]
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: t[n_, k_] /; Divisible[n, k] := Exp[ MangoldtLambda[n/k] ]; t[_, _] = 0; Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, 14}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 28 2013 *)

Clear[t, s, n, k, z, nn];z = 1;nn = 14;t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = If[k == 1, Zeta[s]*(1 - 1/n^(s - 1)) -Sum[t[n, i]/i^(s - 1), {i, 2, n}], If[Mod[n, k] == 0, t[n/k, 1], 0], 0]; A = Table[Table[Limit[t[n, k], s -> z], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, nn}]; Flatten[Exp[A]*Table[Table[If[Mod[n, k] == 0, 1, 0], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, nn}]] (* _Mats Granvik_, Apr 09 2016, May 22 2016 *)
xref: Row products without the zero terms produce A000027. [_Mats Granvik_, Oct 08 2009]
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ and _Mats Granvik_, May 16 2008, Jun 11 2008
